meanings.definition: To cook (food) better than someone else.
meanings.sent1: She outcooked her friend in the baking competition.
meanings.sent2: He always outcooked his siblings when it came to making pancakes.
meanings.sent3: The chef outcooked the amateur cook with ease.
meanings.sent4: Her culinary skills outcooked all the other contestants.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of her outcooked dish filled the kitchen.

meanings.definition: Past tense of outcook: to have cooked (food) better than someone else.
meanings.sent1: Last night, she outcooked everyone at the potluck.
meanings.sent2: They outcooked the other team in the cooking competition.
meanings.sent3: The restaurant outcooked all the other eateries in town.
meanings.sent4: Their outcooked meal was the highlight of the dinner party.
meanings.sent5: The chef proudly displayed the outcooked dish on the menu.
